data.title: Chanak Affair by David Walder
data.meta_description: Chanak Affair by Walder, David and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Condition: Good. Good condition. Good dust jacket. Frontispiece through page 2 bound upside down. With remainder mark. (Great Britain, Turkey, Foreign Relations) A copy that has been read but remains intact. May contain markings such as bookplates, stamps, limited notes and highlighting, or a few light stains.

Hardcover, 8½" x 5½", with dust jacket 380 pages Orange cloth-bound boards with gold type to spine, light-grey endpapers, frontis photograph (Greek Prime Minister Veniselos), 3 maps, 18 b&w photographs, Sources, Bibliography, and Index. Chanak is today called Cannakale, an insignificant little sea port on the Dardanelles. But in 1922 the British Government (headed by a coalition of Lloyd George, Churchill & Birkenhead) decided to wage war with only 3000 troops against the whole Turkish army. Trace the events leading to this disastrous decision, and the results. It was the most serious British crisis in the Middle East until Suez. Learn, too, of the motives and methods of the first 20th century dictator, Kemal Ataturk. Ours is an ex-library copy in transparent protective covering, with usual stamps, stickers, barcode, pocket etc. VERY GOOD book in VERY GOOD unclipped dust jacket.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. Stated First. 1/16" x 1/16" piece missing at the bottom of spine. No rubbing or fading. Price intact. This is a review copy with the slip laid in.

Hardback. 396pp, 13 plates, maps 1969. *An account by the British historian of the British involvement in the Greek-Turkish confrontation in 1922 which brought Britain to the brink of war with Turkey. (FAB). Foreedge slightly speckled, otherwise very good in very good dust jacket.

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: Excellent Dust Jacket. First American Edition. This old book and dust jacket are both in Excellent Condition - Clean, Unmarked and just about As New. This First American Edition hardcover book has 369 pages including many photos. The copyright page states 1969 First American Edition. There is a price of $7.95 on the DJ flap. I have placed a fresh mylar jacket on this old book. We always ship in a sturdy box.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First American edition. 380pp. Illustrated with black and white plates. Fine with remainder dot top edge in a near fine dustwrapper with crease on front flap. An account of the British involvement in the Greek-Turkish confrontation in 1922 which brought Britain to the brink of war with Turkey.

1st edition chipped dust jacket Near Fine octavo 380pp., frontis., b/w pls., maps, bibliog., index, Story of the disastrous defeat of the Greek Army in Smyrna in 1922 and the attempt by Britain to wage War on the victorious Turkish Army with 3000 British Troops at Chanak (Cannakale). Some relevant press-clippings tipped-in and some annotations to prelims by a noted Hungarian historian o/w nice copy of a scarce title.
